Toggle Menu

salt.states.ipset

Management of ipsets

This is an ipset-specific module designed to manage IPSets for use in IPTables Firewalls. 

setname:
  ipset.set_present:
    - set_type: bitmap:ip
    - range: 192.168.0.0/16
    - comment: True

setname:
  ipset.set_absent:
    - set_type: bitmap:ip
    - range: 192.168.0.0/16
    - comment: True

setname_entries:
  ipset.present:
    - set_name: setname
    - entry: 192.168.0.3
    - comment: Hello
    - require:
        - ipset: baz

setname_entries:
  ipset.present:
    - set_name: setname
    - entry:
        - 192.168.0.3
        - 192.168.1.3
    - comment: Hello
    - require:
        - ipset: baz

setname_entries:
  ipset.absent:
    - set_name: setname
    - entry:
        - 192.168.0.3
        - 192.168.1.3
    - comment: Hello
    - require:
        - ipset: baz

setname:
  ipset.flush:

absent

Syntax

salt.states.ipset.absent(
								name,
								entry=None,
								entries=None,
								family='ipv4',
								**kwargs
								)

New in version 2014.7.0.

Remove a entry or entries from a chain

Arguments

Name Description
name

A user-defined name to call this entry by in another part of a state or formula. This should not be an actual entry.

family

Network family, ipv4 or ipv6.

flush

Syntax

salt.states.ipset.flush(
								name,
								family='ipv4',
								**kwargs
								)

New in version 2014.7.0.

Flush current ipset set

Arguments

Name Description
family

Networking family, either ipv4 or ipv6

present

Syntax

salt.states.ipset.present(
								name,
								entry=None,
								family='ipv4',
								**kwargs
								)

New in version 2014.7.0.

Append a entry to a set

Arguments

Name Description
name

A user-defined name to call this entry by in another part of a state or formula. This should not be an actual entry.

entry

A single entry to add to a set or a list of entries to add to a set
family

Network family, ipv4 or ipv6.

set_absent

Syntax

salt.states.ipset.set_absent(
								name,
								family='ipv4',
								**kwargs
								)

New in version 2014.7.0.

Verify the set is absent.

Arguments

Name Description
family

Networking family, either ipv4 or ipv6

set_present

Syntax

salt.states.ipset.set_present(
								name,
								set_type,
								family='ipv4',
								**kwargs
								)

New in version 2014.7.0.

Verify the chain is exist.

Arguments

Name Description
name

A user-defined set name.
set_type

The type for the set
family

Networking family, either ipv4 or ipv6
